('21', 61, 2, 15, 140340) 40. SPEECH ON BOYCOTT OF COUNCILS, LAHORE July 18, 1920
('21', 61, 3, 16, 140396) A prolonged informal conference was held on July 18, 1920, when the question of the boycott of reformed councils as a protest against the Punjab martial law atrocities and khilafat settlement was discussed.
('21', 61, 4, 17, 140603) Mr. Gandhi said with Indians, non participation in the councils was a matter of national honour and self respect and no self respecting Indian could participate until martial law delinquents were punished.
('21', 61, 4, 18, 140809) He said the English people were a high souled race but unfortunately they had been weaned away from the teaching of Jesus Christ by the theories of Bentham, Darwin and other materialistic writers.
('21', 61, 4, 19, 141006) If Indians wanted to be partners with Englishmen, they had got to cultivate virtues of self respect and honour, qualities which alone appealed to Englishmen and they should not be subservient weaklings.
('21', 61, 5, 20, 141209) Incidentally, Mr. Gandhi said knowing as he did the agriculturists of his country and their love and attachment to home and homestead lands, he thought the consequences of non payment of taxes might bring them into collision with the authorities.
('21', 61, 5, 21, 141456) He did not therefore advise them to have recourse to non payment of taxes which was the last stage in his programme.

('21', 63, 6, 13, 143870) July 19, 1920 If the Hindus understand that the seven crore Muslims are their fellow countrymen and that they will not be able to live at enmity with them, they will see that it is their greatest duty to live with the Muslims and die with them.

('21', 63, 6, 18, 144660) I have known Muslims for the last 30 years.

('21', 63, 6, 20, 144787) I have also observed, however, that they have often done mighty deeds in the heat of anger, and that, when the anger subsides, their strength vanishes.
('21', 63, 6, 21, 144939) If we are to make sacrifices in this struggle, we must match the efficiency of the Empire which we are fighting.
('21', 63, 6, 22, 145052) The soldiers forget their anger and fight with discipline, with intelligence and courage.
('21', 63, 6, 23, 145142) If you want to stand against them, you should be intelligent and cultivate courage and discipline.

('21', 72, 3, 17, 167467) 47. MR. ANDREWS’ DIFFICULTY
('21', 72, 4, 18, 167495) Mr. Andrews whose love for India is equalled only by his love for England and whose mission in life is to serve God, i.e., humanity through India, has contributed remarkable articles to The Bombay Chronicle on the khilafat movement.

('21', 73, 1, 25, 170688) Nobody disputes that claim.
('21', 73, 1, 26, 170716) But nobody has ever ascertained that either the Arabs or the Armenians desire to do away with all connection, even nominal, with Turkey.
('21', 74, 0, 1, 170853) VOL. 21 : 1 JULY, 1920 21 NOVEMBER, 1920 75
('21', 74, 1, 2, 170897) The solution of the question lies not in our academic discussion of the ideal position, it lies in an honest appointment of mixed commission of absolutely independent Indian Mussulmans and Hindus and independent Europeans to investigate the real wish of the Armenians and the Arabs and then to come to a modus vivendi whereby the claims of the nationality and those of Islam may be adjusted and satisfied.
('21', 74, 1, 3, 171303) It is common knowledge that Smyrna and Thrace including Adrianople have been dishonestly taken away from Turkey and that mandates have been unscrupulously established in Syria and Mesopotamia and a British nominee has been set up in Hedjaj under the protection of British guns.
('21', 74, 1, 4, 171581) This is a position that is intolerable and unjust.
('21', 74, 1, 5, 171632) Apart therefore from the questions of Armenia and Arabia, the dishonesty and hyprocrisy that pollute the peace terms require to be instantaneously removed.
('21', 74, 1, 6, 171788) It paves the way to an equitable solution of the question of Armenian and Arabian independence which in theory no one denies and which in practice may be easily guaranteed if only the wishes of the people concerned could with any degree of certainty be ascertained.

('21', 74, 2, 8, 172077) 48. INDIANS OVERSEAS
('21', 74, 3, 9, 172098) The meeting 1 held at the Excelsior Theatre in Bombay to pass resolutions regarding East Africa and Fiji and presided over by Sir Narayan Chandavarkar was an impressive gathering.
('21', 74, 3, 10, 172278) The Theatre was filled to overflowing.
('21', 74, 3, 11, 172317) Mr. Andrews’ speech made clear what is needed.
('21', 74, 3, 12, 172364) Both the political and civil rights of Indians of East Africa are at stake.
('21', 74, 3, 13, 172440) Mr. Anantani, himself an East African settler, showed in a forceful speech that the Indians were the pioneer settlers.
('21', 74, 3, 14, 172559) An Indian sailor named Kane directed the celebrated Vasco da Gama to India.
('21', 74, 3, 15, 172635) He added amid applause that Stanley’s expedition for the search and relief of Dr. Livingstone was also fitted out by Indians.
('21', 74, 3, 16, 172761) Indian workmen had built the Uganda Railway at much peril to their lives.
('21', 74, 3, 17, 172835) An Indian contractor had taken the contract.
('21', 74, 3, 18, 172880) Indian artisans had supplied the skill.
('21', 74, 3, 19, 172920) And now their countrymen were in danger of being debarred from its use.
('21', 74, 4, 20, 172992) 1 Vide “Speech on Fiji Affairs, Bombay”, 13 7 1920.
('21', 75, 0, 1, 173044) 76 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('21', 75, 1, 2, 173085) The uplands of East Africa have been declared a Colony and the lowlands a Protectorate.
('21', 75, 1, 3, 173173) There is a sinister significance attached to the declaration.
('21', 75, 1, 4, 173235) The Colonial system gives the Europeans larger powers.
('21', 75, 1, 5, 173290) It will tax all the resources of the Government of India to prevent the healthy uplands from becoming a whiteman’s preserve and the Indians from being relegated to the swampy lowlands.
('21', 75, 1, 6, 173475) The question of franchise will soon become a burning one.
('21', 75, 1, 7, 173533) It will be suicidal to divide the electorate or to appoint Indians by nomination.
('21', 75, 1, 8, 173615) There must be one general electoral roll applying the same qualifications to all the voters.
('21', 75, 1, 9, 173708) This principle, as Mr. Andrews reminded the meeting, had worked well at the Cape.
('21', 75, 2, 10, 173790) The second part of the East African resolution shows the condition of our countrymen in the late German East Africa.
('21', 75, 2, 11, 173907) Indian Soldiers fought there and now the position of Indians is worse than under German rule.
('21', 75, 2, 12, 174001) H. H. the Aga Khan suggested that German East Africa should be administered from India.
('21', 75, 2, 13, 174089) Sir Theodore Morison would have cooped up all Indians in German East Africa.
('21', 75, 2, 14, 174166) The result was that both the proposals went by the board and the expected had happened.
('21', 75, 2, 15, 174254) The greed of the English speculator has prevailed and he is trying to squeeze out the Indian.
('21', 75, 2, 16, 174348) What will the Government of India protect?
('21', 75, 2, 17, 174391) Has it the will to do so?
('21', 75, 2, 18, 174417) Is not India itself being exploited?
('21', 75, 2, 19, 174454) Mr. Jehangir Petit recalled the late Mr. Gokhale’s views that we were not to expect a full satisfaction regarding the status of our countrymen across the seas until we had put our own house in order.
('21', 75, 2, 20, 174654) Helots in our own country, how could we do better outside?
('21', 75, 2, 21, 174713) Mr. Petit wants systematic and severe retaliation.
('21', 75, 2, 22, 174764) In my opinion, retaliation is a double edged weapon.
('21', 75, 2, 23, 174817) It does not fail to hurt the user if it also hurts the party against whom it is used.
('21', 75, 2, 24, 174903) And who is to give effect to retaliation?
('21', 75, 2, 25, 174945) It is too much to expect an English Government to adopt effective retaliation against their own people.
('21', 75, 2, 26, 175049) They will expostulate, they will remonstrate, but they will not go to war with their own Colonies.
('21', 75, 2, 27, 175148) For the logical outcome of retaliation must mean war, if retaliation will not answer.
('21', 75, 2, 28, 175234) Let us face the facts frankly.
('21', 75, 2, 29, 175265) The problem is difficult alike for Englishmen and for us.
('21', 75, 2, 30, 175323) The Englishmen and Indians do not agree in the Colonies.
('21', 75, 2, 31, 175380) The Englishmen do not want us where they can live.
('21', 75, 2, 32, 175431) Their civilization is different from ours.
('21', 75, 2, 33, 175474) The two cannot coalesce until there is mutual respect.
('21', 75, 2, 34, 175529) The Englishman considers himself to belong to the ruling race.
('21', 75, 2, 35, 175592) The Indian struggles to think that he does not
('21', 76, 0, 1, 175639) VOL. 21 : 1 JULY, 1920 21 NOVEMBER, 1920 77
('21', 76, 1, 2, 175683) belong to the subject race and in the very act of thinking admits his subjection.
('21', 76, 1, 3, 175765) We must then attain equality at home before we can make any real impression abroad.
('21', 76, 1, 4, 175849) This is not to say that we must not strive to do better abroad whilst we are ill at ease in our own home.
('21', 76, 1, 5, 175955) We must preserve, we must help our countrymen who have settled ouside India.
('21', 76, 1, 6, 176032) Only if we recognize the true situation, we and our countrymen abroad will learn to be patient and know that our chief energy must be concentrated on a betterment of our position at home.
('21', 76, 1, 7, 176220) If we can raise our status here to that of equal partners not in name but in reality so that every Indian might feel it, all else mustfollow as a matter of course.
('21', 76, 1, 8, 176384) The question of Fiji is a different propostion, though it too is affected by the same considerations.
('21', 76, 1, 9, 176486) There it is no longer a question of status.
('21', 76, 1, 10, 176530) We simply want to know why there was martial law, why there was shooting, why were Mr. and Mrs. Manilal Doctor deported without trial and without even being heard in their defence.
('21', 76, 1, 11, 176711) The Government have kept us too long waiting.
('21', 76, 1, 12, 176757) We must insist on full justice being done and we must bring back as speedily as possibe all those who wish to return to the motherland.
('21', 76, 1, 13, 176893) Young India, 21 7 1920
('21', 76, 2, 14, 176916) 49. “HIJRAT” AND ITS MEANING
('21', 76, 3, 15, 176945) India is a continent.
('21', 76, 3, 16, 176967) Its articulate thousands know what its inarticulate millions are doing or thinking.
('21', 76, 3, 17, 177051) The Government and the educated Indians may think that the khilafat movement is merely a passing phase.
('21', 76, 3, 18, 177155) The millions of Mussulmans think otherwise.
('21', 76, 3, 19, 177199) The flight of the Mussulmans is growing apace.
('21', 76, 3, 20, 177246) The newspapers contain paragraphs in out of the way corners informing the readers that a special train containing a barrister with sixty women, forty children including twenty sucklings, all told 765, have left for Afghanistan.
('21', 76, 3, 21, 177474) They are cheered en route.
('21', 76, 3, 22, 177501) They were presented with cash, edibles and other things, and were joined by more muhajarin on the way.
('21', 76, 3, 23, 177604) No fanatical preaching by a Shaukat Ali can make people break up and leave their homes for an unknown land.
('21', 76, 3, 24, 177712) There must be an abiding faith in them.
('21', 76, 3, 25, 177752) That it is better for them to leave a State which has no regard for their religious sentiment and face a beggar’s life than to remain in it even though it may be in a princely manner.
('21', 76, 3, 26, 177936) Nothing but pride of power can blind the Government of India to the scene that is being enacted before it.
('21', 77, 0, 1, 178043) 78 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('21', 77, 1, 2, 178084) But there is yet another side to the movement.
('21', 77, 1, 3, 178131) Here are the facts as stated in the following Government communique dated 10th instant :
('21', 77, 2, 4, 178220) An unfortunate affair in connection with the muhajarin occurred on the
('21', 77, 3, 5, 178291) 8th instant at Kacha Garhi between Peshwar and Jamrud.
('21', 77, 3, 6, 178346) Thefollowing are the
('21', 77, 4, 7, 178367) as at present reported.
('21', 77, 4, 8, 178391) Two members of a party of the muhajarin proceeding
('21', 77, 5, 9, 178442) by train to Jamrud were detected by the British military travelling without tickets.
('21', 77, 5, 10, 178527) Altercation ensued at Islamia College station, but the train proceeded to Kacha Garhi.
('21', 77, 5, 11, 178614) An attempt was made to evict these muhajarin, whereupon the military police were attacked by a crowd of some forty muhajarin and the
('21', 77, 6, 12, 178747) British officer who intervened was seriously wounded with a spade.
('21', 77, 6, 13, 178814) A detachment of Indian troops at Kacha Garhi thereupon fired two or three shots at the muhajarin for making murderous assault on the British officer.
('21', 77, 6, 14, 178964) One muhajarin was killed and one wounded and three arrested.
('21', 77, 6, 15, 179025) Both the military and the police were injured.
('21', 77, 6, 16, 179072) The body of the muhajarin was despatched to
('21', 77, 7, 17, 179116) Peshawar and buried on the morning of the 9th.
('21', 77, 7, 18, 179163) This incident has caused considerable excitement in Peshawar city, and the Khilafat Hijrat Committee
('21', 77, 8, 19, 179264) are exercising restraining influence.
('21', 77, 8, 20, 179302) Shops were closed on the morning of the 9th.
('21', 77, 8, 21, 179347) A full enquiry has been instituted.
('21', 77, 8, 22, 179383) Now, Peshawar to Jamrud is a matter of a few miles.
('21', 77, 8, 23, 179435) It was clearly the duty of the military not to attempt to pull out the ticketless muhajarin for the sake of a few annas.
('21', 77, 8, 24, 179556) But they actually attempted force.
('21', 77, 8, 25, 179591) Intervention by the rest of the party was a foregone conclusion.
('21', 77, 8, 26, 179656) An altercation ensued.
('21', 77, 8, 27, 179679) A British officer was attacked with a spade.
('21', 77, 8, 28, 179724) Firing and a death of a muhajarin was the result.
('21', 77, 8, 29, 179774) Has British prestige been enhanced by the episode?
('21', 77, 8, 30, 179825) Why have not the Government put tactful officers in charge at the frontier, whilst a great religious emigration is in progress?
('21', 77, 8, 31, 179953) The action of the military will pass from tongue to tongue throughout India and the Mussulman world around, will no doubt be unconsciously and even consciously exaggerated in the passage and the feeling bitter as it already is will grow in bitterness.
('21', 77, 8, 32, 180205) The communique says that the Government are making further inquiry.
('21', 77, 8, 33, 180273) Let us hope that it will be full and that better arrangements will be made to prevent a repetition of what appears to have been a thoughtless act on the part of the military.
('21', 77, 8, 34, 180448) And may I draw the attention of those who are opposing non co operation that unless they find out a substitute they should either join the non co operation movement or prepare to face a disorganized subterranean upheaval whose effect no one can foresee and whose spread it would be impossible to check or regulate?

('21', 78, 1, 2, 180830) 50. HARTAL ON FIRST AUGUST
('21', 78, 2, 3, 180857) The Central Khilafat Committee, Bombay, has issued the following
('21', 78, 3, 4, 180922) instructions : Although every effort is being made to secure revision of the Peace Terms, it appears to be almost certain that it will not come before the first of August next.
('21', 78, 3, 5, 181099) The Committee desires to mark the sacred character of the forthcoming demonstration of non co operation in a fitting manner.
('21', 78, 3, 6, 181224) It also wishes to gauge the public feeling in the matter.
('21', 78, 3, 7, 181282) The Committee, therefore, seeks the co operation of Hindus and other non Muslim communities in making the inauguration a complete success : 1. The Committee advises full hartal on the first of August.
('21', 78, 3, 8, 181483) Mill hands, however, are requested not to abstain from work, unless they receive permission from their employers, nor should all those abstain who are required for absolutely necessary day to day work, viz, hospital men, sanitary men and dock labourers.
('21', 78, 3, 9, 181737) 2. The day should be devoted to prayer.
('21', 78, 3, 10, 181777) All those, who can, should fast for the day.
('21', 78, 3, 11, 181822) 3. Meetings should be held all over the country not excluding the smallest village at which the following resolution should be adopted with or without speeches :
('21', 78, 4, 12, 181984) THE RESOLUTION
('21', 78, 5, 13, 181999) “This meeting held at .
('21', 78, 5, 14, 182023) of the inhabitants records its full sympathy with the movement of the Central Khilafat Committee in order to secure revision of the Turkish Peace Terms, consistently with Muslim sentiment and Islamic law and approves of non co operation adopted by the Central Khilafat Committee to be continued till the Peace Terms are revised.
('21', 78, 5, 15, 182352) This meeting respectfully urges the Imperial Government in the interest of the Empire which they are supposed to represent to secure a just revision of the Terms which have been universally condemned as unjust and manifestly in breach of ministerial declarations.” The resolution should be sent to His Excellency the Viceroy with a covering letter requesting him to forward the same to the Imperial Government.
('21', 78, 5, 16, 182763) The Central Khilafat Committee should be advised of the passing of the resolution and of its despatch.

('21', 79, 2, 3, 182939) N.B. There should be no processions.
('21', 79, 2, 4, 182976) Speeches should be restrained.
('21', 79, 2, 5, 183007) It is expected that meetings everywhere will be very largely attended.
('21', 79, 2, 6, 183078) All police and other Governmental instructions or regulations should be strictly and scrupulously obeyed.
('21', 79, 2, 7, 183184) No meetings should be held where there is any written prohibition.

('21', 79, 2, 9, 183472) It should be clearly understood that this is not a movement of civil disobedience.
('21', 79, 2, 10, 183555) What should be done when unreasonable orders are issued interfering with the liberty of the subject will be considered on the merits by the Committee.
('21', 79, 2, 11, 183706) RENOUNCE TITLES It is expected that all title holders, Honorary Magistrates, Justices of Peace, Members of the Legislative Councils, who feel about this important question affecting the well being of millions of Muslims, and who are in sympathy with the movement, will surrender their titles or honorary posts on this day.

('21', 80, 1, 2, 184665) 51. SPEECH AT IDGAH, KARACHI
('21', 80, 2, 3, 184694) July 22, 1920
('21', 80, 3, 4, 184708) The caliphate meeting at Karachi was held on the 22nd July at the Idgah, with Professor Vaswani 1 as president.
('21', 80, 3, 5, 184820) The following spoke : Professor Vaswani, Gandhi, Dr. Kitchlew, Shaukat Ali and Lokamal Chellaram Seth of Karachi.
('21', 80, 3, 6, 184934) Vaswani opened the proceedings and was followed by Gandhi, who, feeling unwell, spoke sitting down.
('21', 80, 3, 7, 185034) Before coming to the reasons of my visit to Karachi, I wish to refer to the scene at the railway station.
('21', 80, 3, 8, 185140) We were to arrive this morning, but owing to an unfortunate railway accident and subsequent blocking of the line, we did not arrive till 9 p.m.
('21', 80, 3, 9, 185284) The Karachi City station was overcrowded; many were in the sheds and many were whistling.
('21', 80, 3, 10, 185374) What impression did I get from this?
('21', 80, 3, 11, 185411) I realized your affection for me, but affection does not mean obstructing the platform and preventing me, the one you love, getting out.
('21', 80, 3, 12, 185548) This is the result of lack of education and knowledge.
('21', 80, 3, 13, 185603) What is the use of volunteers if they are unable to control crowds and do not obey the orders of their officers?
('21', 80, 3, 14, 185716) Work cannot proceed under these circumstances.
('21', 80, 3, 15, 185763) The railway station incident being finished, I bring to your notice the fact that our Muhammadan brothers are suffering for the caliphate.
('21', 80, 3, 16, 185902) The British Parliament and the Viceroy have forgotten their pledges.
('21', 80, 3, 17, 185971) I ask all Hindus to help Muhammadans in this time of trouble.
('21', 80, 3, 18, 186033) If this is not done then the Hindus must bear in mind that slavery will be at the door of not only seven crores of Muhammadans but at the door of twenty two crores of Hindus also.
('21', 80, 3, 19, 186213) We have held meetings, delivered speeches, passed resolutions, and sent deputations to request that the feelings of Muhammadans be respected.
('21', 80, 3, 20, 186355) Nothing has resulted from this.
('21', 80, 3, 21, 186387) Turkey has been forced to face difficulties and hardships.
('21', 80, 3, 22, 186446) To obtain a decision on the caliphate question, you will have to give your own blood.
('21', 80, 3, 23, 186532) What do you understand by giving blood?
('21', 80, 3, 24, 186572) It does not mean that you should kill the British in whose hands the caliphate decision is, but that you should be ready silently to sacrifice your own lives.
('21', 80, 3, 25, 186731) To attain this, manly power is necessary.
('21', 80, 3, 26, 186773) What is manly power?
('21', 80, 3, 27, 186794) The power full of spiritual strength.
('21', 80, 3, 28, 186832) What is spiritual strength?
('21', 80, 3, 29, 186860) To become a khatri.
('21', 80, 3, 30, 186880) What is a khatri?
('21', 80, 3, 31, 186898) A sepoy.
('21', 80, 4, 32, 186907) 1 T. L. Vaswani (1879); sage from Sind; author and founder of Mira educational institutions, Poona

('21', 84, 7, 7, 191676) 57. SPEECH AT SIND NATIONAL COLLEGE
('21', 84, 8, 8, 191712) July 24, 1920
('21', 84, 9, 9, 191726) The Sind National College received a visit from Mahatma Gandhi early this morning (Saturday, 24th).
('21', 84, 9, 10, 191826) He was received at the gate by the staff and the students, and was shown round the various departments.
('21', 84, 9, 11, 191930) Returning to the hall in company with Shrimati Saraladevi Chaudhrani he was presented with an address in Hindi.The Mahatma replied in Hindi.
('21', 84, 9, 12, 192071) He said he was gratified to receive the Hindi address, as Hindi was one of the things that he had at heart and which he had been preaching from the platform and the Press.
('21', 84, 9, 13, 192243) The best way of showing respect to a man, he said, was to do as he tells one to do, not to clap and cheer him.
('21', 84, 9, 14, 192354) It filled his heart with great pain when he thought over the system of education that was in vogue in the country.
('21', 84, 9, 15, 192469) Those who had been brought up under that system could not see its many defects and the great harm that it had done to the spirit of nationality.
('21', 84, 9, 16, 192614) He himself had received his fair share of it and recognized that it had done some good, but nothing filled him with greater pain than to see his countrymen ridden by that veneer of English polish.
('21', 84, 9, 17, 192811) He had lived in England long enough, and knew that no Englishman ever talked to another Englishman except in their common mother tongue.
('21', 84, 9, 18, 192948) It gave him immense pain when he heard Indians talking with their brother Indians in a foreign tongue.
('21', 84, 9, 19, 193051) He quoted Prof.
('21', 84, 9, 20, 193067) Jadunath Sarkar 2 and Mr. Sidgwick 3 as saying that the burden of English

('21', 85, 1, 2, 193478) over the head of the Indian student was so heavy as to crush out all original thinking.
('21', 85, 1, 3, 193566) For the Sindhi student, he would advise the study of Sindhi first and that of Hindi after it.
('21', 85, 1, 4, 193660) Hindi was to be the language of the whole of India, and therefore its study was incumbent on the other provinces, so that all might come together on a common platform.
('21', 85, 1, 5, 193828) For these among other reasons in which he could not enter then, he was gratified to find that Hindi was being encouraged in the Sind National College.
('21', 85, 2, 6, 193979) He then passed on to the other subject that he had equally at heart viz., swadeshi.
('21', 85, 2, 7, 194063) The mainstay of the people of India was agriculture.
('21', 85, 2, 8, 194116) But they wanted also a subsidiary occupation to fall back upon in times of difficulty and drought.

('21', 85, 2, 12, 194435) At the present hour this and other similar industries had fallen on evil days.

('21', 85, 2, 14, 194617) This they could do by using swadeshi cloth in preference to foreign cloth and goods, however attractive in appearance.
('21', 85, 2, 15, 194736) That will give work to thousands of women.

('21', 85, 2, 17, 194917) He was glad to see that carpet weaving was being taught in the Sind National College alng with agriculture.
('21', 85, 2, 18, 195025) He hoped that when he happened to visit Hyderabad next, he would find cloth weaving being taught, too.
('21', 85, 3, 19, 195128) In conclusion, Mahatmaji expressed great pleasure at being able to see the students and the staff of the College, and his gratitude for the hearty reception that they had given him.
('21', 85, 4, 20, 195310) He was sorry that the time at his disposal was short, he could not speak as long as he would have wished.
('21', 85, 4, 21, 195416) He wished the College all prosperity, and hoped that it would be largely patronized by those for whose good it was intended.
('21', 85, 5, 22, 195541) The party then left amidst shouts of “Vandemataram” and “Mahatma ki jai”.

('21', 88, 6, 10, 200039) 62. MR. MONTAGU ON THE KHILAFAT AGITATION
('21', 88, 7, 11, 200081) Mr. Montagu does not like the khilafat agitation that is daily gathering force.
('21', 88, 7, 12, 200161) In answer to questions put in the House of Commons, he is reported to have said that whilst he acknowledged that I had rendered distinguished services to the country in the past, he could not look upon my present attitude with equanimity and that it was not to be expected that I could now be treated as leniently as I was during the Rowlatt Act agitation.
('21', 88, 7, 13, 200518) He added that he had every confidence in the central and the local Governments, that they were carefully watching the movement and that they had full power to deal with the situation.
('21', 88, 7, 14, 200702) This statement of Mr. Montagu has been regarded in some quarters as a threat.
('21', 88, 7, 15, 200780) It has even been considered to be a blank cheque for the Government of India to re establish the reign of terror if they chose.
('21', 88, 7, 16, 200908) It is certainly inconsistent with his deisre to base the Government on the goodwill of the people.
('21', 88, 7, 17, 201007) At the same time if the Hunter Committee’s finding be true and if I was the cause of the disturbances last year, I was undoubtedly treated with exceptional leniency.
('21', 88, 7, 18, 201173) I admit too that my activity this year is fraught with greater peril to the Empire as it is being conducted today than was last year’s activity.
('21', 88, 7, 19, 201318) Non co operation in itself is more harmless than civil disobedience, but in its effect it is far more dangerous for the Government than civil disobedience.
('21', 88, 7, 20, 201474) Non co operation is intended so far to paralyse the Government, as to compel justice from it.
('21', 88, 7, 21, 201568) If it is carried to the extreme point, it can bring the Government to a
('21', 89, 0, 1, 201640) 90 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('21', 89, 1, 2, 201681) standstill.
('21', 89, 1, 3, 201693) A friend who has been listening to my speeches once asked me whether I did not come under the sedition section of the Indian Penal Code.
('21', 89, 1, 4, 201830) Though I had not fully considered it, I told him that very probably I did and that I could not plead “not guilty” if I was charged under it.
('21', 89, 1, 5, 201971) For I must admit that I can pretend to no “affection” for the present Govern ment.
('21', 89, 1, 6, 202054) And my speeches are intended to create “disaffection” such that the people might consider it a shame to assist or co operate with a Government that had forfeited all title to confidence, respect or support.
('21', 89, 1, 7, 202261) I draw no distinction between the Imperial and the Indian Government.
('21', 89, 1, 8, 202331) The latter has accepted, on the khilafat, the policy imposed upon it by the former.
('21', 89, 1, 9, 202415) And in the Punjab case the former has endorsed the policy of terrorism and emasculation of a brave people initiated by the latter.
('21', 89, 1, 10, 202546) British ministers have broken their pledged word and wantonly wounded the feelings of the seventy million Mussulmans of India.
('21', 89, 1, 11, 202673) Innocent men and women were insulted by the insolent officers of the Punjab Government.
('21', 89, 1, 12, 202761) Their wrongs not only remain unrighted, but the very officers who so cruelly subjected them to barbarous humiliation retain office under the Government.
('21', 89, 1, 13, 202914) When at Amritsar last year I pleaded 1 with all the earnestness I could command for co operation with the Government and for response to the wishes expressed in the Royal Proclamation, I did so because I honestly believed that a new era was about to begin, and that the old spirit of fear, distrust and consequent terrorism was about to give place to the new spirit of respect, trust and goodwill.
('21', 89, 1, 14, 203312) I sincerely believed that the Mussulman sentiment would be placated and that the officers that had misbehaved during the martial law regime in the Punjab would be at least dismissed and the people would be otherwise made to feel that a Government that had always been found quick (and rightly) to punish popular excesses would not fail to punish its agents’ misdeeds.
('21', 89, 1, 15, 203680) But to myamazement and dismay, I have discovered that the present representatives of the Empire have become dishonest and unscrupulous.
('21', 89, 1, 16, 203816) They have no regard for the wishes of the people of India and they count Indian honour as of little consequence.
('21', 89, 1, 17, 203929) I can no longer retain affection for a Government so evilly manned as it is now a days.
('21', 89, 1, 18, 204017) And for me, it is humiliating to retain my
('21', 89, 2, 19, 204060) 1 Vide Speech on Reforms Resolution at Amritsar Congress”, 1 1 1920
('21', 90, 0, 1, 204128) VOL. 21 : 1 JULY, 1920 21 NOVEMBER, 1920 91
('21', 90, 1, 2, 204172) freedom and be witness to the continuing wrong.
('21', 90, 1, 3, 204220) Mr. Montagu however is certainly right in threatening me with deprivation of my liberty if I persist in endangering the existence of the Government.
('21', 90, 1, 4, 204369) For that must be the result if my activity bears fruit.
('21', 90, 1, 5, 204425) My only regret is that inasmuch as Mr. Montagu admits my past services, he might have perceived that there must be something exceptionally bad in the Government if a well wisher like me could no longer give his affection to it.
('21', 90, 1, 6, 204653) It was simpler to insist on justice being done to the Mussulmans and to the Punjab than threaten me with punishment so that the injustice might be perpetuated.
('21', 90, 1, 7, 204813) Indeed I fully expect it will be found that even in promoting disaffection towards an unjust Government I had rendered greater services to the Empire than I am already credited with.
('21', 90, 1, 8, 204996) At the present moment, however, the duty of those who approve of my activity is clear.
('21', 90, 1, 9, 205083) They ought on no account to resent the deprivation of my liberty, should the Government of India deem it to be their duty to take it away.
('21', 90, 1, 10, 205222) A citizen has no right to resist such restriction imposed in accordance with the laws of the State to which he belongs.
('21', 90, 1, 11, 205342) Much less have those who sympathize with him.
('21', 90, 1, 12, 205388) In my case there can be no question of sympathy.
('21', 90, 1, 13, 205437) For I deliberately oppose the Government to the extent of trying to put its very existence in jeopardy.
('21', 90, 1, 14, 205541) For my supporters, therefore, it must be a moment of joy when I am imprisoned.
('21', 90, 1, 15, 205620) It means the beginning of success if only the supporters continue the policy for which I stand.
('21', 90, 1, 16, 205716) If the Government arrest me, they would do so in order to stop the progress of non co operation which I preach.It follows that if non co operation continues with unabated vigour, even after my arrest the Government must imprison others or grant the people’s wish in order to gain their co operation.
('21', 90, 1, 17, 206016) Any eruption of violence on the part of the people even under provocation would end in disaster.
('21', 90, 1, 18, 206113) Whether therefore it is I or anyone else who is arrested during the campaign, the first condition of success is that there must be no resentment shown against it.
('21', 90, 1, 19, 206276) We cannot imperil the very existence of a Government and quarrel with its attempt to save itself by punishing those who place it in danger.
('21', 90, 2, 20, 206416) Young India, 28 7 1920
('21', 91, 0, 1, 206439) 92 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('21', 91, 1, 2, 206480) 63. A NOTED RESIGNATION
('21', 91, 2, 3, 206504) During the eventful tour of the khilafat party in the Punjab, I was given a copy of a letter of resignation by a sub divisional officer 1
('21', 91, 3, 4, 206642) over the khilafat question.
('21', 91, 3, 5, 206670) It is printed elsewhere in this issue.
('21', 91, 3, 6, 206709) The letter shows clearly how different classes of Mussulmans are being affected by the Turkish Peace Terms.
('21', 91, 3, 7, 206817) It is an unforgettable wrong that England has been primarily responsible for doing to the Mussulman world.
('21', 91, 3, 8, 206924) And as time passes, the movement for compelling its undoing will gain instead of losing strength.
('21', 91, 3, 9, 207022) When an official of twenty years’ standing and considered to be almost indispensable decides to leave a Government in respect of great wrong to which it has been a party, it is time for it to review the act that has prompted a resignation such as Mr. Mohamed Azam has felt called upon to tender.
('21', 91, 3, 10, 207318) But my purpose in publishing the resignation is not so much to draw the Government’s attention to it (for they have it already) but to congratulate Mr. Mohamed Azam and to present the public with an example worthy of copying.
('21', 91, 3, 11, 207544) Mr. Mohamed Azam from a purely worldly standpoint has sacrificed a position which many would covet.
('21', 91, 3, 12, 207644) From the standpoint of religion or honour, he has gained by his resignation.
('21', 91, 3, 13, 207721) What are position and money at the sacrifice of one’s conscience?
('21', 91, 3, 14, 207787) His superior officers, be it said to their credit, have recommended it for acceptance because it has been tendered for conscience’ sake.
('21', 91, 3, 15, 207924) If the higher branches of the Government service were to copy Mr. Mohamed Azam’s brave example, the movement might attain the goal without the lowest ranks having to give up their employment.
('21', 91, 3, 16, 208116) Mr. Mohamed Azam’s is an instance of positive courage.
('21', 91, 3, 17, 208171) It is always difficult to find positive courage.
('21', 91, 3, 18, 208220) But I hope there is enough negative courage in India to ensure that nobody applies for the post vacated by Mr. Mohamed Azam.
('21', 91, 3, 19, 208345) It is almost certain that no Mohammedan will.
('21', 91, 3, 20, 208391) But I hope that Hindus will be equally staunch and testify to their Mussulman brethren that they are fully alive to the difficulty in which they find themselves and that they will not be behind in giving them their active support.
('21', 91, 3, 21, 208622) The critics may say, it will be unnecessary for any Indian to apply because it is a post which any Englishman will be glad to fill.
('21', 91, 4, 22, 208754) 1 Of Abbotabad
('21', 92, 0, 1, 208769) VOL. 21 : 1 JULY, 1920 21 NOVEMBER, 1920 93
('21', 92, 1, 2, 208813) do not doubt it for a moment.
('21', 92, 1, 3, 208843) Only the condition is somewhat different from the ordinary when a post is voluntarily relinquished by way of protest and when no one belonging to the protestant class applies for it.
('21', 92, 1, 4, 209026) The only thing needful is to cease to make of Government employment a fetish.
('21', 92, 1, 5, 209104) There are many other avenues open to an honest man of ability to earn a decent livelihood.
('21', 92, 1, 6, 209195) After all Government servants represent a microscopic minority of the population.

('21', 92, 2, 8, 209300) 64. THE FIRST OF AUGUST
('21', 92, 3, 9, 209324) It is hardly likely that before the 1st August there will be on the part of His Majesty’s ministers promise of a revision of the Peace Terms and the consequent suspension of the inauguration of non co operation.
('21', 92, 3, 10, 209536) The first of August next will be as important an event in the history of India as was the 6th of April last year.
('21', 92, 3, 11, 209650) The sixth of April marked the beginning of the end of the Rowlatt Act.
('21', 92, 3, 12, 209721) No one can consider, the Rowlatt Act can possibly live in the face of the agitation that has only been suspended—never given up.
('21', 92, 3, 13, 209850) It must be clear to anyone that the power that wrests justice from an unwilling Government in the matter of the Punjab and the khilafat will be the power that will secure repeal of the Rowlatt Act.
('21', 92, 3, 14, 210048) And that power is the power of satyagraha whether it is known by the name of civil disobedience or non co operation.
('21', 92, 3, 15, 210165) Many people dread the advent of non co operation, because of the events of last year.
('21', 92, 3, 16, 210251) They fear madness from the mob and consequent repetition of last year’s reprisals almost unsurpassed in their ferocity in the history of modern times.
('21', 92, 3, 17, 210402) Personally I do not mind Governmental fury as I mind mob fury.
('21', 92, 3, 18, 210465) The latter is a sign of national distemper and therefore more difficult to deal with than the former which is confined to a small corporation.
('21', 92, 3, 19, 210608) It is easier to oust a Government that has rendered itself unfit to govern than it is to cure unknown people in a mob of their madness.
('21', 92, 3, 20, 210744) But great movements cannot be stopped altogether because a Government or a people or both go wrong.
('21', 92, 3, 21, 210844) We learn to profit through our mistakes and failures.
('21', 92, 3, 22, 210898) No general worth the name gives up a battle because he has suffered reverses, or which is the same thing, made mistakes.
('21', 92, 3, 23, 211019) And so we must approach non co operation with confidence and hope.
('21', 92, 3, 24, 211086) As in the past, the commencement is to be marked by fasting and prayer a sign of
('21', 93, 0, 1, 211167) 94 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('21', 93, 1, 2, 211208) the religious character of the demonstration.
('21', 93, 1, 3, 211254) There should also be on that day suspension of business, and meetings to pass resolutions praying for revision of the Peace Terms and justice for the Punjab and inculcating non co operation until justice has been done.
('21', 93, 1, 4, 211473) The giving up of titles and honorary posts should also commence from the first of August.
('21', 93, 1, 5, 211563) Doubt has been expressed as to the sufficiency of notice regarding surrender of titles and honorary posts.
('21', 93, 1, 6, 211670) It is however quickly dispelled by bearing in mind that the first of August marks the commencement of the surrender of titles.
('21', 93, 1, 7, 211797) It is not the only day on which surrender has to take place.
('21', 93, 1, 8, 211858) Indeed I do not expect a very large response on the first day.
('21', 93, 1, 9, 211921) A vigorous propaganda will have to be carried on and the message delivered to every title or post holder and the argument presented to him proving the duty of such surrender.
('21', 93, 1, 10, 212096) But the greatest thing in this campaign of non co operation is to evolve order, discipline, co operation among the people, co ordination among the workers.
('21', 93, 1, 11, 212252) Effective non co operation depends upon complete organization.
('21', 93, 1, 12, 212315) Thousands of men who have filled meetings throughout the Punjab have convinced me that the people want to withdraw co operation from the Government but they must know how.
('21', 93, 1, 13, 212487) Most people do not understand the complicated machinery of the Government.
('21', 93, 1, 14, 212562) They do not realize that every citizen silently but nonetheless certainly sustains the Government of the day in ways of which he has no knowledge.
('21', 93, 1, 15, 212709) Every citizen therefore renders himself responsible for every act of his Government.
('21', 93, 1, 16, 212794) And it is quite proper to support it so long as the actions of the Government are bearable.
('21', 93, 1, 17, 212886) But when they hurt him and his nation, it becomes his duty to withdraw his support.

('21', 94, 2, 3, 213756) Last week I dealt 1 with the muhajarin who was shot.

('21', 94, 2, 5, 213976) As the statement purports to come from responsible parties and as it contains a version at variance with that of the communique, I deem it to be my duty to place it before the public and invite the Government’s attention to it.
('21', 94, 2, 6, 214204) If the facts set forth in the statement are true, they reflect the greatest discredit on the so called soldiers who took wanton delight in killing a man who was endeavouring to protect the honour of women.
('21', 94, 2, 7, 214410) I understand that the N.W. Frontier Administration are holding a judicial inquiry into the matter.
('21', 94, 2, 8, 214509) But the public has become so suspicious even about inquires described as judicial, that unless it is a really independent and honest inquiry, no weight will be attached to its findings.
('21', 94, 2, 9, 214695) If therefore the Government do not wish to lay themselves open to the charge of having hushed up an unmanly act on the part of the British soldiers they will not dread publicity and they will invite the most trusted men to investigate the matter.
('21', 94, 2, 10, 214942) No local men merely can possibly be considered sufficient to ensure impartiality.
('21', 94, 2, 11, 215024) The incident is of no small importance.
('21', 94, 2, 12, 215064) General Dyer unfortunately talked of the lives and honour of English women being held sacred in India.
('21', 94, 2, 13, 215167) I hope that India holds the honour and life of every woman dear and sacred.

('21', 96, 1, 2, 217711) 67. SPEECH AT BOMBAY
('21', 96, 2, 3, 217732) July 29, 1920
('21', 96, 3, 4, 217746) Before a crowded meeting of Mussulmans in Muzaffarabad at Bombay held on
('21', 96, 4, 5, 217819) the 29th July, speaking on the impending non co operation which commenced on
('21', 96, 5, 6, 217896) the 1st of August, Mr. Gandhi said the time for speeches on non co operation was
('21', 96, 6, 7, 217977) past and the time for practise had arrived.
('21', 96, 6, 8, 218021) But two things were needful for complete
('21', 96, 7, 9, 218062) success, an environment free from any violence on the part of the people and a spirit
('21', 96, 8, 10, 218148) of self sacrifice.
('21', 96, 8, 11, 218167) Non co operation, as the speaker had conceived it, was an
('21', 96, 9, 12, 218225) impossibility in an atmosphere surcharged with the spirit of violence.
('21', 96, 9, 13, 218296) Violence was
('21', 96, 10, 14, 218309) an exhibition of anger and any such exhibition was dissipation of valuable energy.
('21', 96, 11, 15, 218392) Subduing of one’s anger was a storing up of national energy, which, when set free in
('21', 96, 12, 16, 218477) an ordered manner, would produce astounding results.
('21', 96, 12, 17, 218530) His conception of non co 
('21', 96, 13, 18, 218556) operation did not involve rapine, plunder, incendiarism and all the concomitants of
('21', 96, 14, 19, 218640) mass madness.
('21', 96, 14, 20, 218654) His scheme presupposed ability on their part to control all the forces
('21', 96, 15, 21, 218725) of evil.
('21', 96, 15, 22, 218734) If, therefore, any disorderliness was found on the part of the people which
('21', 96, 16, 23, 218810) they could not control, he for one would certainly help the Government to control
('21', 96, 17, 24, 218892) In the presence of disorder it would be for him a choice of evil, and evil though
('21', 96, 18, 25, 218974) he considered the present Government to be, he would not hesitate for the time being
('21', 96, 19, 26, 219059) to help the Government to control disorder.
('21', 96, 19, 27, 219103) But he had faith in the people.
('21', 96, 20, 28, 219135) believed that they knew that the cause could only be won by non violent methods.
('21', 96, 21, 29, 219216) To put it at the lowest the people had not the power, even if they had the will, to
('21', 96, 22, 30, 219300) resist with brute strength the unjust Governments of Europe who had, in the
('21', 96, 23, 31, 219376) intoxication of their success disregarding every canon of justice dealt so cruelly by
('21', 96, 24, 32, 219462) the only Islamic Power in Europe.
('21', 96, 24, 33, 219496) MATCHLESS WEAPON
('21', 96, 25, 34, 219513) In non co operation they had a matchless and powerful weapon.
('21', 96, 25, 35, 219575) It was a sign
('21', 96, 26, 36, 219589) of religious atrophy to sustain an unjust Government that supported an injustice by
('21', 96, 27, 37, 219673) resorting to untruth and camouflage.
('21', 96, 27, 38, 219710) So long therefore as the Government did not
('21', 96, 28, 39, 219754) purge itself of the canker of injustice and untruth, it was their duty to withdraw all
('21', 96, 29, 40, 219841) help from it consistently with their ability to preserve order in the social structure.
('21', 96, 30, 41, 219929) The first stage of non co operation was, therefore, arranged so as to involve
('21', 96, 31, 42, 220007) minimum of danger to public peace and minimum of sacrifice on the part of those
('21', 96, 32, 43, 220087) who participated in the movement.
('21', 96, 32, 44, 220121) And if they might not help an evil Government
('21', 96, 33, 45, 220167) nor receive any favours from it, it followed that they must give up all titles of
('21', 96, 34, 46, 220249) honour which were no longer a proud possession.
('21', 96, 34, 47, 220297) Lawyers who were in reality
('21', 96, 35, 48, 220325) honorary officers of the court, should cease to support courts that upheld the
('21', 97, 0, 1, 220404) 98 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI

('21', 97, 2, 4, 220568) Similarly parents should withdraw their children
('21', 97, 3, 5, 220617) from the public schools and they must evolve a system of national education or
('21', 97, 4, 6, 220696) private education totally independent of the Government.
('21', 97, 4, 7, 220753) An insolent Government

('21', 98, 1, 2, 222604) 68. TELEGRAM ON THIRD KHILAFAT DAY 1
('21', 98, 2, 3, 222641) BOMBAY, July 31, 1920
('21', 98, 3, 4, 222663) THE NON CO OPERATION COMMITTEE HAS ISSUED THE FOLLOWING DIRECTIONS REGARDING THE THIRD KHILAFAT DAY : “THE FIRST OF AUGUST IS ON US WITH ITS GRAVE RESPONSIBILITY AND IMPORTANT CONSEQUENCES.
('21', 98, 3, 5, 222853) WE BELIEVE THAT SUCCESS FOR OUR JUST CAUSE IS CERTAIN IF WE EXERCISE GREATEST SELF RESTRAINT AND SHOW AMPLE MEASURE OF SELF SACRIFICE.
('21', 98, 3, 6, 222988) IF WE CEASE TO HELP GOVERNMENT AND CEASE TO TAKE HELF FROM IT WE MUST BE CAPABLE OF PRESERVING ORDER IN THE COUNTRY.
('21', 98, 3, 7, 223105) WE SHOULD THEREFORE AVOID COLLISION WITH AUTHORITY AND THUS ALSO OCCASION FOR SUDDEN RESENTMENT, OBEY ALL ORDERS AND GOVERNMENT NOTICES.
('21', 98, 3, 8, 223242) WE HOPE THERE WILL BE COMPLETE HARTAL ON SUNDAY.
('21', 98, 3, 9, 223291) NO PRESSURE SHOULD BE USED AGAINST ANYONE REFUSING TO CLOSE SHOP.
('21', 98, 3, 10, 223357) THE COMMITTEE ATTACHES GREATEST IMPORTANCE TO PRAYER AND FASTING FOR INWARD STRENGTH AND PURIFICATION.
('21', 98, 3, 11, 223460) WE HOPE TOO THAT LARGEST MEETINGS EVER HELD WILL BE CONVENED ON SUNDAY BUT THERE SHOULD BE NO PROCESSIONS.
('21', 98, 3, 12, 223567) SPECIAL EFFORT SHOULD BE MADE AND CONTINUED TO SECURE SURRENDER OF TITLES AND HONORARY POSTS AND PARENTS ARE REQUESTED TO WITHDRAW THEIR CHILDREN FROM SCHOOLS RECOGNIZED BY OR UNDER GOVERNMENT CONTROL.
('21', 98, 3, 13, 223769) LAWYERS ARE REQUESTED TO SUSPEND PRACTICE.
('21', 98, 3, 14, 223812) WE HAVE NO DOUBT ABOUT THE MORAL EFFECT OF THESE STEPS.
('21', 98, 3, 15, 223868) WE HOPE ALSO THAT FULL SWADESHI WILL BE INAUGURATED ON SUNDAY IT ENABLES EVERY MAN, WOMAN AND CHILD TO EXHIBIT IN THEIR OWN PERSONS THE SPIRIT OF SACRIFICE.
('21', 98, 3, 16, 224025) IT WILL BE AT ONCE AN EARNEST OF OUR DESIRE FOR SACRIFICE FOR THE SAKE OF OUR RELIGION AND HONOUR AND A PREPARATION FOR FURTHER SACRIFICE.
('21', 98, 3, 17, 224164) AGITATION FOR SECURING COMPLETE BOYCOTT OF COUNCILS SHOULD BE CONTINUED UNABATED.
('21', 98, 3, 18, 224246) FINALLY THE COMMITTEE EXPECTS MUSLIMS TO LEAD AS WELL IN PRESERVING PEACE AND ORDER AS IN SACRIFICE AND WE FEEL SURE THAT OUR HINDU BRETHREN WILL NOT FAIL TO RESPOND AND JOIN THE MUSLIMS.”

('21', 99, 1, 2, 224578) 69. OUR DUTY
('21', 99, 2, 3, 224591) August 1 is already upon us.
('21', 99, 2, 4, 224620) All manner of objections are being raised against non co operation, the most important being that it is bound to lead to violent disturbances.
('21', 99, 2, 5, 224763) It is quite easy to save ourselves from this possible danger.
('21', 99, 2, 6, 224825) There should be no difficulty at all in preserving peace if there are even a few persons at every place working towards that end.
('21', 99, 2, 7, 224955) The very first require ment of non co operation is to preserve peace.
('21', 99, 2, 8, 225025) If we do not know how to do this, we have no right to start non co opertation.
('21', 99, 2, 9, 225104) Some people cite the example of the Sinn Fein movement in Ireland and say that non co operation and assassinations go on simulta neously there.
('21', 99, 2, 10, 225248) This is quite true, but Ireland will not get Home Rule that way.
('21', 99, 2, 11, 225313) There is, moreover, an important difference between us and Ireland.
('21', 99, 2, 12, 225381) We can very easily gain our object by non violent non co opera tion and, if violence breaks out, non co operation will stop that very moment.
('21', 99, 2, 13, 225523) Through the method of violence and bloodshed, the people can get nothing in big country like India; likewise, no power in the world can rule over such a vast country as ours if there is peaceful non cooperation.
('21', 99, 2, 14, 225735) That is why our best success lies in preventing the outbreak of violence.
('21', 99, 2, 15, 225809) If violence does break out, we ourselves would, and we ought to, rush immediately to the help of the Government to stop it.
('21', 99, 2, 16, 225933) Breaking out of riots can only mean that we have failed to acquire control over our own people.
('21', 99, 2, 17, 226029) The second objection to non co operation is that the people are not at all ready for it.
('21', 99, 2, 18, 226118) This really means that the people have no capacity for self sacrifice.
('21', 99, 2, 19, 226189) If we regard it as an honour to be honoured by a Government that has gone to the last limits of injustice, if we receive education in its schools and continue to practise as lawyers in its courts, how can we demonstrate that we have felt hurt by its actions?
('21', 99, 2, 20, 226448) Some others ask me what effect can be produced on the Government if a few men renounce their titles, a few others withdraw their children from schools and a handful of lawyers stop practising in lawcourts.
('21', 99, 2, 21, 226654) This objection is not valid.
('21', 99, 2, 22, 226683) If we think it a sin to help an unjust Governmnet or to receive any favour from it, then, whether we be few or many, it becomes our duty to give up helping it or receiving favours from it, and this is also the only straightforward way of making others in larger numbers do likewise.
('21', 100, 0, 1, 226966) VOL. 21 : 1 JULY, 1920 21 NOVEMBER, 1920 101
('21', 100, 1, 2, 227011) No reform anywhere in the world has ever been immediately accepted by all the people.
('21', 100, 1, 3, 227097) It is always a few who make a beginning and, when others see the firmness of those few, they follow in the footsteps of the latter.
('21', 100, 1, 4, 227229) Often reforms make no progress because people take up the attitude that they will adopt them when others do likewise.
('21', 100, 1, 5, 227347) This attitude always results in delay and does much harm sometimes.
('21', 100, 1, 6, 227415) Moreover, waiting for all the others or a majority of them bespeaks our want of faith in our duty.
('21', 100, 1, 7, 227514) I trust, therefore, that those who are convinced that it is their duty to stop helping the Government will begin non co operation forthwith, no matter whether they are few or many.
('21', 100, 1, 8, 227695) [From Gujarati] Navajivan, 1 8 1920
('21', 100, 2, 9, 227731) 70. MR. MONTAGU’S THREAT
('21', 100, 3, 10, 227756) There is no need at all to get excited over the threat 1 which Mr. Montagu held out while replying to a question about the khilafat.
('21', 100, 3, 11, 227889) Regarding the ultimate aim, there is no difference between the views of Mr. Montagu and of others in authority.
('21', 100, 3, 12, 228001) It is the usual way of these, when they want to do something in opposition to public opinion, to leave nothing undone in putting down the people.
('21', 100, 3, 13, 228147) How can we expect Mr. Montagu to be free from this mentality?
('21', 100, 3, 14, 228209) The people are raising their heads against the injustices in the Punjab and about the khilafat.
('21', 100, 3, 15, 228305) If they are allowed to follow their way, authority will have to yield.
('21', 100, 3, 16, 228376) This they do not want to do.
('21', 100, 3, 17, 228405) So it is left with no alternative but to go all out to bend the people.
('21', 100, 3, 18, 228477) If, in this situation, the people are behind me and follow my advice, what else can the Government do but arrest me?
('21', 100, 3, 19, 228594) The Government can have one of three aims in arresting me : 1. To frighten me into changing my views.
('21', 100, 3, 20, 228696) 2. To separate me from the people and thus weaken public opinion.
('21', 100, 3, 21, 228762) 3. By removing me from their midst, to test the people and see whether they are really agitated over the injustices.
('21', 100, 3, 22, 228879) I suppose that it cannot be their object to frighten me.
('21', 100, 4, 23, 228936) 1 Montagu had declared in the House of Commons that “if Mr. Gandhi persisted in ‘non co operation’, it would be absolutely impossible to take the same view of his action as was taken last year”.
('21', 101, 0, 1, 229131) 102 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('21', 101, 1, 2, 229173) Government will certainly want to weaken public opinion, but it is more reasonable to believe that it wants to test the people.
('21', 101, 1, 3, 229301) It has a right to do so.
('21', 101, 1, 4, 229326) If the people, however, stand the test and show their mettle, that very day they will win.
('21', 101, 1, 5, 229417) We cannot complain against being tested in this way.
('21', 101, 1, 6, 229470) What, then, should the people do if I am arrested?
('21', 101, 1, 7, 229521) The very nature of our fight requires us to be always ready for jail.
('21', 101, 1, 8, 229591) My imprisonment, therefore, should be welcome to the people.
('21', 101, 1, 9, 229652) At any rate, it should not make them angry.
('21', 101, 1, 10, 229696) If I do things which invite imprisonment and then run away from it, or if the people feel aggrieved over my arrest, then the fault lies not with the Government but with us.
('21', 101, 1, 11, 229869) In an oppressive and unjust State, a prison is the only place where a subject is really free.
('21', 101, 1, 12, 229963) I, therefore, hope that, if I am arrested, the people will go ahead with non co operation with still greater vigour.
('21', 101, 1, 13, 230080) Perhaps the Government would welcome the people losing their self control.
('21', 101, 1, 14, 230155) That would give it a chance to use force.
('21', 101, 1, 15, 230197) Even if the Government does not want this, the result would be the same, namely, that it would subject the people to repression.
('21', 101, 1, 16, 230326) If, therefore, the people have understood the meaning of non co operation, they should not abandon it, even if I or any others should be arrested but show to the Government that it cannot rule the people without their consent.
('21', 101, 1, 17, 230553) But the question will naturally be asked why Mr. Montagu should be doubly guilty by taking the wrong road of repression over people.
('21', 101, 1, 18, 230686) He has already one crime to his credit, of being a party to the injustice [done to India].
('21', 101, 1, 19, 230777) Repression of the people in order to perpetuate that injustice would now be the second crime.
('21', 101, 1, 20, 230871) The right course would be, seeing that the people are ready to go to the length of adopting non co operation, to bow to public opinion and, by undoing the injustice, remove the root cause of non co operation.
('21', 101, 1, 21, 231080) Mr. Montagu admits that, through my activities till now, I have rendered nothing but service to the Empire.
('21', 101, 1, 22, 231188) That service naturally includes the satyagraha which I have launched on different occasions.
('21', 101, 1, 23, 231281) As a matter of fact, my chief services to the Empire lie in securing redress of grievances by means of satyagraha.
('21', 101, 1, 24, 231396) I am sure that what I am doing at present is my greatest service.
('21', 101, 1, 25, 231462) Even this time, all I am doing is to offer satyagraha.
('21', 101, 1, 26, 231517) Non co operation is but a branch of the big tree of satyagraha.
('21', 101, 1, 27, 231581) The regret is that, regardless of this, Mr.
('21', 102, 0, 1, 231625) VOL. 21 : 1 JULY, 1920 21 NOVEMBER, 1920 103
('21', 102, 1, 2, 231670) Montagu thinks me mistaken in my present activity.
('21', 102, 1, 3, 231721) When a friend of the Empire like myself takes up the extreme weapon of non co operation, Mr. Montagu should have realized that the people must have been seriously aggrieved and ought to have striven hard to secure justice for us.
('21', 102, 1, 4, 231951) If, then, his efforts had failed, he could have resigned.
('21', 102, 1, 5, 232009) But he has chosen the wrong course.
('21', 102, 1, 6, 232045) I now hope that the public will answer Mr. Montagu’s threat by remaining peaceful and carrying out the non co operation programme.
('21', 102, 1, 7, 232176) [From Gujarati] Navajivan, 1 8 1920
('21', 102, 2, 8, 232212) 71. VISIT OF THE PRINCE OF WALES
('21', 102, 3, 9, 232245) The view which I have expressed, that in our present state of feelings we cannot join in welcoming the Prince of Wales, should he pay a visit, is considered by Mr. Montagu to be a disloyal suggestion.
('21', 102, 3, 10, 232446) This is a sign of changed times.

('21', 107, 4, 7, 242528) 75. SPEECH ON KHILAFAT DAY, BOMBAY 1
('21', 107, 5, 8, 242565) August 1, 1920
('21', 107, 6, 9, 242580) Mr. M. K. Gandhi moved the following resolution : This meeting records its full sympathy with the movement of the Central Khilafat Committee in order to secure revision of the Turkish Peace Terms consistently with Muslim sentiment and Islamic Law, and approves of non co operation adopted by the Central Khilafat Committee to be continued till the Peace Terms are revised.
('21', 107, 6, 10, 242953) This meeting respectfully urges the Imperial Government, in the interest of the Empire which they are supposed to represent, to secure a just revision of the Terms which have been universally condemned as unjust and manifestly in breach of ministerial declaration.
('21', 107, 7, 11, 243218) Mr. Gandhi said he read in newspapers Government and others telling him that India was not at one with him in this question of non co operation and that the movement of non co operation would end in the country’s ruin.
('21', 107, 7, 12, 243437) Now those who joined in the non co operation movement could best refute those assertions not by merely attending such meetings and passing such resolutions but by actually practising non co operation.
('21', 107, 7, 13, 243638) The first thing they could do in this connection was to renounce all titles, medals and hoonoray posts.
('21', 107, 7, 14, 243742) He would like to inquire how many of them that attended the meeting had done so.
('21', 107, 7, 15, 243823) Perhaps very few of those that were present there were possessors of such titles and posts.
('21', 107, 7, 16, 243915) But this did not mean that those who possessed no titles or medals themselves had no duty to perform in this connection.
('21', 107, 7, 17, 244036) For it should be their duty to ask with due respect those, who did hold the titles and honorary posts, to give them up.
('21', 107, 7, 18, 244156) First of all they should ask Honorary Magistrates to resign their posts; secondly, they should ask their friends to withdraw their children from Government schools and ask teachers to resign their posts.
('21', 107, 7, 19, 244360) This would have the effect of showing Government that the people were

('21', 108, 1, 4, 244898) Thirdly, he would ask men of the legal profession to give up their practice.
('21', 108, 1, 5, 244975) He entirely repudiated the suggestion that legal practitioners would be doing a public service by continuing to practise in courts of law.

('21', 108, 3, 22, 247015) At the present stage of the industry in India, the cotton mills were not in a position to produce fine cloth and the people must be content with the coarser quality of it.
('21', 108, 3, 23, 247187) The remedy for the present lay in a revival of the handloom industry.

('21', 108, 3, 25, 247572) If they practised swadeshi with vigour and enthusiasm they would save crores of rupees to India.

('21', 111, 5, 18, 253688) The Hon’ble Pundit Malaviyaji, for whom I entertain the highest regard and whom I have so often described as dharmatma 2, has appealed to me both publicly and privately to suspend non co operation till the Congress has pronounced upon it.

('21', 111, 5, 20, 253964) These appeals have made me pause and think, but I regret to say that I have not been able to respond to them.
('21', 111, 5, 21, 254074) I would do much and give much to please Punditji.

('21', 111, 5, 23, 254197) But a higher duty requires me not to turn from the course mapped out by the Non co operation Committee.
('21', 111, 5, 24, 254301) There are moments in your life when you must act, even though you cannot carry your best friends with you.

('21', 112, 1, 5, 254864) In my humble opinion it is no Congressman’s duty to consult the Congress before taking an action in a matter in which he has no doubts.
('21', 112, 1, 6, 255000) To do otherwise may mean stagnation.
('21', 112, 1, 7, 255037) The Congress is after all the mouthpiece of the nation.
('21', 112, 1, 8, 255093) And when one has a policy or a programme which one would like to see adopted, but on which one wants to cultivate public opinion, one naturally asks the Congress to discuss it and form an opinion.
('21', 112, 1, 9, 255290) But when one has an unshakable faith in a particular policy or action, it would be folly to wait for the Congress pronouncement.
('21', 112, 1, 10, 255419) On the contrary one must act and demonstrate its efficacy so as to command acceptance by the nation.
('21', 112, 1, 11, 255520) My loyalty to the Congress requires me to carry out its policy when it is not contrary to my conscience.
('21', 112, 1, 12, 255625) If I am in a minority I may not pursue my policy in the name of the Congress.
('21', 112, 1, 13, 255703) The decision of the Congress on any given question therefore does not mean that it prevents a Congressman from any action to the contrary, but if he acts, he does so at his own risk and with the knowledge that the Congress is not with him.Every Congressman, every public body has the right, it is sometimes their duty, to express their own opinion, act upon it even and thus anticipate the verdict of the Congress.
('21', 112, 1, 14, 256118) Indeed it is the best way of serving the nation.
('21', 112, 1, 15, 256167) By initiating well thought out policies, we furnish data for a great deliberative body like the Congress to enable it to form a well informed opinion.
('21', 112, 1, 16, 256318) The Congress cannot express national opinion with any definiteness, unless at least some of us have already firm views about a particular course of conduct.
('21', 112, 1, 17, 256475) If all suspended their opinion, the Congress must necessarily suspend its own.

('21', 113, 2, 21, 258620) 80. WHO IS DISLOYAL?
('21', 113, 2, 22, 258641) Mr. Montagu has discovered a new definition of disloyalty.
('21', 113, 2, 23, 258700) He considers my suggestion to boycott the visit of the Prince of Wales to be disloyal and some newspapers taking the cue from him have called persons who have made the suggestion “unmannerly”.
('21', 113, 2, 24, 258893) They have even attributed to these “unmannerly” persons the suggestion of “boycotting the Prince”.
('21', 113, 2, 25, 258992) I draw a sharp and fundamental distinction between boycotting the Prince and boycotting any welcome arranged for him.
('21', 113, 2, 26, 259110) Personally I would extend the heartiest welcome to His Royal Highness if he came or could come without official patronage and the protecting wings of the Government of the day.
('21', 113, 2, 27, 259287) Being the heir to constitutional monarch, the Prince’s movements are regulated and dictated by the ministers, no matter how much the dictation may
('21', 114, 0, 1, 259434) VOL. 21 : 1 JULY, 1920 21 NOVEMBER, 1920 115
('21', 114, 1, 2, 259479) be concealed beneath diplomatically polite language.
('21', 114, 1, 3, 259532) In suggesting the boycott therefore the promoters have suggested boycott of an insolent bureaucracy and dishonest ministers of His Majesty.
('21', 114, 1, 4, 259672) You cannot have it both ways.
('21', 114, 1, 5, 259702) It is true that under a constitutional monarchy, the Royalty is above politics.
('21', 114, 1, 6, 259782) But you cannot send the Prince on a political visit for the purpose of making political capital out of him, and then complain that those, who will not play your game and, in order to checkmate you, proclaim a boycott of the Royal visit, do not know constitutional usage.
('21', 114, 1, 7, 260053) For the Prince‘s visit is not for pleasure.
('21', 114, 1, 8, 260097) His Royal Highness is to come in Mr. Lloyd George’s words, as the “Ambassador of the British Nation”, in other words, his own ambassador in order to issue a certificate of merit to him and possibly to give the ministers a new lease of life.
('21', 114, 1, 9, 260338) The wish is designed to consolidate and strengthen a power that spells mischief for India.
('21', 114, 1, 10, 260429) Even as it is, Mr. Montagu has foreseen that the welcome will probably be excelled by any hitherto extended to Royalty, meaning that the people are not really and deeply affected and stirred by the official atrocities in the Punjab and the manifestly dishonest breach of official declarations on the khilafat.
('21', 114, 1, 11, 260739) With the knowledge that India was bleeding at heart, the Government of India should have told His Majesty’s ministers that the moment was inopportune for sending the Prince.
('21', 114, 1, 12, 260913) I venture to submit that it is adding insult to injury to bring the Prince and through his visit to steal honours and further prestige for a Government that deserves to be dismissed with disgrace.
('21', 114, 1, 13, 261110) I claim that I prove my loyalty by saying that India is in no mood, is too deeply in mourning, to take part in any welcome to His Royal Highness, and that the ministers and the Indian Government show their disloyalty by making the Prince a cat’s paw of their deep political game.
('21', 114, 1, 14, 261390) If they persist, it is the clear duty of India to have nothing to do with the visit.

('21', 115, 1, 2, 261539) 81. CRUSADE AGAINST NON CO OPERATION
('21', 115, 2, 3, 261576) I have most carefully read the manifesto 1 addressed by Sir Narayan Chandavarkar and others dissuading the people from joining the non co operation movement.
('21', 115, 2, 4, 261734) I had expected to find some solid argu ment against non co operation, but to my great regret I have found in it nothing but distortion (no doubt unconscious) of the great religions and history.
('21', 115, 2, 5, 261928) The manifesto says that “non co operation is deprecated by the religious tenets and traditions of our motherland, nay, of all the religions that have saved and elevated the human race.” I venture to submit that the Bhagavad Gita is a gospel of non co operation between forces of darkness and those of light.
('21', 115, 2, 6, 262236) If it is to be literally interpreted, Arjuna representing a just cause was enjoined to engage in bloody warfare with the unjust Kauravas 2. Tulsidas 3 advises the Sant (the good) to shun the Asant (the evil doers).
('21', 115, 2, 7, 262451) The Zend Avesta re presents a perpetual duel between Ormuzd and Ahriman, between whom there is no compromise.
('21', 115, 2, 8, 262561) To say of the Bible that it taboos non co operation is not to know Jesus, a prince among passive resisters, who uncompromisingly challenged the might of the Sadducees and the Pharisees and for the sake of truth did not hesitate to divide sons from their parents.
('21', 115, 2, 9, 262824) And what did the Prophet of Islam do?
('21', 115, 2, 10, 262862) He non co operated in Mecca in a most active manner so long as his life was not in danger and wiped the dust of Mecca off his feet when he found that he and his followers might have uselessly to perish, and fled to Medina and returned when he was strong enough to give battle to his opponents.
('21', 115, 2, 11, 263156) The duty of non co operation with unjust men and king is as strictly enjoined by all the religions as is the duty of co operation with just men and kings.
('21', 115, 2, 12, 263311) Indeed most of the scriptures of the world seem even to go beyond non co operation and prefer violence to effeminate submission to a wrong.
('21', 115, 2, 13, 263451) The Hindu religious tradition, of which the manifesto speaks, clearly proves the duty of non co operation.

('21', 117, 1, 2, 266546) 82. COW PROTECTION Cow protection is an article of faith in Hinduism.
('21', 117, 1, 3, 266616) Apart from its religious sanctity, it is an ennobling creed.
('21', 117, 1, 4, 266677) But we, Hindus, have today little regard for the cow and her progeny.
('21', 117, 1, 5, 266747) In no country in the world are cattle so ill fed and ill kept as in India.
('21', 117, 1, 6, 266822) In beef eating England it would be difficult to find cattle with bones sticking out of their flesh.
('21', 117, 1, 7, 266922) Most of our pinjrapoles 1 are ill managed and ill kept.
('21', 117, 1, 8, 266978) Instead of being a real blessing to the animal world, they are perhaps simply receiving depots for dying animals.
('21', 117, 1, 9, 267092) We say nothing to the English in India for whose sake hundreds of cows are slaughtered daily.
('21', 117, 1, 10, 267186) Our rajas do not hesitate to provide beef for their English guests.
('21', 117, 1, 11, 267254) Our protection of the cow, therefore, extends to rescuing her from Mussulman hands.
('21', 117, 1, 12, 267338) This reverse method of cow protection has led to endless feuds and bad blood between Hindus and Mussulmans.
('21', 117, 1, 13, 267446) It has probably caused greater slaughter of cows than otherwise would have been the case if we had begun the propaganda in the right order.
('21', 117, 1, 14, 267586) We should have commenced, as we ought now to commence, with ourselves and cover the land with useful propaganda leading to kindness in the treatment of cattle and scientific knowledge in the management of cattle farms, dairies and pinjrapoles.
('21', 117, 1, 15, 267830) We should devote our attention to propaganda among Englishmen in the shape of inducing them voluntarily to abandon beef, or, if they will not do so, at least be satisfied with imported beef.
('21', 117, 1, 16, 268021) We should secure prohibition of export of cattle from India and we should adopt means of increasing and purifying our milk supply.
('21', 117, 1, 17, 268152) I have not a shadow of doubt that if we proceed along these sane lines, we would secure voluntary Mussulman support, and when we have ceased to compel them to stop killing cows on their festival days, we would find that they have no occasion for insisting on killing them.
('21', 117, 1, 18, 268425) Any show of force on our part must lead to retaliation and exacerbation of feeling.
('21', 117, 1, 19, 268509) We may not make Mussulmans or anybody respect our feelings religious or otherwise by force.
('21', 117, 1, 20, 268601) We can really do so only by exciting their fellow feeling.
('21', 117, 2, 21, 268660) Hence it is that I have declined, and I am sure quite wisely, to enter into any bargain on the khilafat question.

('21', 120, 9, 10, 273012) 86. PASSING AWAY OF THE LOKAMANYA
('21', 120, 10, 11, 273046) The Lokamanya was in a class by himself.
('21', 120, 10, 12, 273087) The country has proved that the title which the people gave to Tilak Maharaj was a hundred thousand times more precious than any that could be conferred by a king.

('21', 120, 10, 16, 273488) In France it is the practice to say : “The King is dead; long live the King.” That idea spread to Britain and other countries and, whenever a king dies, they proclaim : “The King is dead; long live the King.” It means much in substance that the King never dies and the State machine never stops even for a second.
('21', 120, 10, 17, 273802) In quite the same way, the mammoth meeting in Bombay has sho wn that Tilak Maharaj can never die, is not dead, that he is living and will live for ever.
('21', 120, 10, 18, 273955) His relatives, indeed, may have been stricken with grief and their eyes may have dropped pearls, but the villagers from the Ghats who went out with their musical instruments did by no means go weep ing and lamenting.

('21', 132, 1, 2, 300385) 91. THE DOCTRINE OF THE SWORD
('21', 132, 2, 3, 300415) In this age of the rule of brute force, it is almost impossible for anyone to believe that anyone else could possibly reject the law of the final supremacy of brute force.
('21', 132, 2, 4, 300587) And so I receive anonymous letters advising me that I must not interfere with the progress of non co operation even though popular violence may break out.
('21', 132, 2, 5, 300742) Others come to me and assuming that secretly I must be plotting violence, inquire when the happy moment for declaring open violence will arrive.
('21', 132, 2, 6, 300887) They assure me that the English will never yield to anything but violence secret or open.
('21', 132, 2, 7, 300977) Yet others, I am informed, believe that I am the most rascally person living in India because I never give out my real intention and that they have not a shadow of a doubt that I believe in violence just as much as most people do.
('21', 132, 3, 8, 301208) Such being the hold that the doctrine of the sword has on the majority of mankind, and as success of non co operation depends principally on absence of violence during its pendency and as my views in this matter affect the conduct of a large number of people, I am anxious to state them as clearly as possible.
('21', 132, 4, 9, 301519) I do believe that where there is only a choice between cowardice and violence I would advise violence.
('21', 132, 4, 10, 301622) Thus when my eldest son asked me what he should have done, had he been present when I was almost fatally assaulted in 1908, 1 whether he should have run away and seen me killed or whether he should have used his physical force which he could and wanted to use, and defended me, I told him that it was his duty to defend me even by using violence.
('21', 132, 4, 11, 301969) Hence it was that I took part in the Boer War, the so called Zulu rebellion and the late War.
('21', 132, 4, 12, 302063) Hence also do I advocate training in arms for those who believe in the method of violence.
('21', 132, 4, 13, 302154) I would rather have India resort to arms in order to defend her honour than that she should in a cowardly manner become or remain a helpless witness to her own dishonour.
('21', 132, 4, 14, 302325) But I believe that non violence is infinitely superior to violence, forgiveness is more manly than punishment.
('21', 132, 4, 15, 302436) Forgiveness adorns a soldier.
('21', 132, 4, 16, 302466) But abstinence is forgiveness only when

('21', 133, 1, 2, 302589) proceed from a helpless creature.

('21', 133, 1, 25, 304209) It is meant for the common people as well.
('21', 133, 1, 26, 304252) Non violence is the law of our species as violence is the law of the brute.
('21', 133, 1, 27, 304328) The spirit lies dormant in the brute and he knows no law but that of physical might.
('21', 133, 1, 28, 304413) The dignity of man requires obedience to a higher law—to the strength of the spirit.
('21', 133, 1, 29, 304498) I have therefore ventured to place before India the ancient law of self sacrifice.
('21', 133, 1, 30, 304581) For satyagraha and its off shoots, non co operation and civil resistance, are nothing but new names for the law of suffering.

('21', 134, 1, 2, 304936) known the use of arms, they realized their uselessness and taught a weary world that its salvation lay not through violence but through non violence.
('21', 134, 1, 3, 305086) Non violence in its dynamic condition means conscious suffering.
('21', 134, 1, 4, 305151) It does not mean meek submission to the will of the evildoer, but it means the putting of one’s soul against the will of the tyrant.
('21', 134, 1, 5, 305284) Working under this law of our being, it is possible for a single individual to defy the whole might of an unjust empire to save his honour, his religion, his soul and lay the foundation for that empire’s fall or its regeneration.
('21', 134, 2, 6, 305514) And so I am not pleading for India to practise non violence because it is weak.
